questions.question: .Which of the following statements is true about parameterized constructors in Java?

answers.b: Parameterized constructors are called using the new keyword.
answers.c: Parameterized constructors have parameters that are used to initialize instance variables.
answers.d: Parameterized constructors are used to create static objects.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true about the number of parameterized constructors that can be defined for a class in Java?

answers.a: A class can have only one parameterized constructor
answers.b: A class can have multiple parameterized constructors, but they must have the same number of parameters.
answers.c: A class can have multiple parameterized constructors, with different numbers and types of parameters.
answers.d: A class cannot have parameterized constructors.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true about default constructors and parameterized constructors in Java?

answers.a: A class can have both a default constructor and a parameterized constructor.
answers.b: If a class has a parameterized constructor, it cannot have a default constructor.
answers.c: If a class has a default constructor, it cannot have a parameterized constructor.
answers.d: Default constructors and parameterized constructors are the same thing.
